publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3902# Mr Duncan McNeil: Greenock Telegraph Brighter Smiles Campaign—That the Parliament acknowledges the importance of ensuring that children get into the habit of regular visits to the dentist at as early an age as possible; expresses concern that some 5,300 children and young people in Inverclyde are not registered with a dentist; notes that this amounts to approximately one-third of the children in the area; further notes that research by Greenock’s Phoenix Community Health Project found that parents were unsure about where, when and with whom to register a child, and therefore congratulates the Greenock Telegraph for running a very successful, high-profile campaign to get local children signed up with a dentist and on the road to better oral health throughout their lives.
S2M-3902# Greenock Telegraph Brighter Smiles Campaign (lodged on 31 January 2006) Mr Brian Monteith*, Donald Gorrie*, Trish Godman*

S2M-3902# Mr Duncan McNeil: Greenock Telegraph Brighter Smiles Campaign—That the Parliament acknowledges the importance of ensuring that children get into the habit of regular visits to the dentist at as early an age as possible; expresses concern that some 5,300 children and young people in Inverclyde are not registered with a dentist; notes that this amounts to approximately one-third of the children in the area; further notes that research by Greenock’s Phoenix Community Health Project found that parents were unsure about where, when and with whom to register a child, and therefore congratulates the Greenock Telegraph for running a very successful, high-profile campaign to get local children signed up with a dentist and on the road to better oral health throughout their lives. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Donald Gorrie, Trish Godman
S2M-3902# Greenock Telegraph Brighter Smiles Campaign (lodged on 31 January 2006) Scott Barrie*
S2M-3902# Greenock Telegraph Brighter Smiles Campaign (lodged on 31 January 2006) Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-3902# Greenock Telegraph Brighter Smiles Campaign (lodged on 31 January 2006) Murray Tosh*
S2M-3902# Greenock Telegraph Brighter Smiles Campaign (lodged on 31 January 2006) Elaine Smith*
